questions.question: What is the primary reason countries engage in international trade?

options.A: To exploit their absolute or comparative advantages
options.B: To ensure they never have to import goods
options.C: To decrease the variety of goods available to consumers
options.D: To increase the cost of production

questions.question: The ability of a country to produce a good at a lower opportunity cost than another country is called:

options.A: Absolute advantage

questions.question: Which economist is credited with developing the theory of 'Comparative Advantage'?

options.A: David Ricardo

questions.question: A tax imposed on imported goods is known as a:

options.A: Quota

questions.question: The 'Balance of Payments' is a record of all economic transactions between:

options.A: Residents of a country and the rest of the world
options.B: Different states within a single country
options.D: The Central Bank and commercial banks

questions.question: Which account in the Balance of Payments records the export and import of goods and services?

options.A: Capital Account

questions.question: A 'Trade Deficit' occurs when a country's:

options.A: Exports of goods exceed its imports
options.B: Government spending is less than its tax revenue
options.C: Imports of goods exceed its exports

questions.question: The price of one nation's currency in terms of another nation's currency is the:

options.A: Exchange rate

questions.question: If the Ethiopian Birr moves from 50 to 60 Birr per 1 USD, the Birr has:

options.A: Appreciated

questions.question: Which international organization was primarily created to oversee the global financial system and provide loans to countries in crisis?

options.A: International Monetary Fund (IMF)

questions.question: Free trade is defined as a policy where the government:

options.A: Owns all means of production
options.B: Bans all imports from other continents
options.C: Does not discriminate against imports or interfere with exports
options.D: Sets the price for all traded goods

questions.question: An 'Embargo' is a government order that:

options.A: Completely prohibits trade with a particular country
options.C: Reduces taxes on imported luxury items
options.D: Increases the supply of foreign currency

questions.question: The 'Terms of Trade' refers to the ratio of:

options.A: Unemployment to inflation

questions.question: The World Bankâ€™s main purpose is to provide:

options.A: Long-term loans for development projects in developing nations

questions.question: Globalization is characterized by the increasing:

options.A: Integration of world economies through trade and financial flows

questions.question: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) occurs when:

options.A: A citizen buys a foreign car
options.B: A country receives a grant from the UN
options.C: A company from one country builds a factory in another country
options.D: A person goes on vacation abroad

questions.question: Protectionism is an economic policy designed to:

options.A: Restrict imports to protect domestic industries
options.C: Increase the flow of foreign goods

questions.question: The 'Infant Industry Argument' suggests that:

options.A: New industries need temporary protection from foreign competition
options.B: Only old industries should be taxed
options.C: Children should not work in factories
options.D: Agriculture is the only important sector

questions.question: A 'Fixed' exchange rate system is one where the currency value is:

options.A: Determined solely by market demand and supply
options.B: Changed every hour by commercial banks
options.C: Pegged to another currency or a precious metal like gold

questions.question: The 'Visible Trade' part of the Current Account includes:

options.A: Trade in physical goods (tangibles)

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an 'Invisible' export for Ethiopia?

options.A: Selling coffee to Germany
options.C: Providing Ethiopian Airlines services to foreigners
options.D: Selling gold to the Middle East

questions.question: A 'Quota' is a protectionist measure that limits:

options.A: The quantity of a good that can be imported
options.B: The amount of tax a company pays
options.C: The number of hours a person can work

questions.question: The acronym WTO stands for:

options.A: World Tourism Organization

questions.question: A 'Managed Float' exchange rate system involves:

options.A: Government intervention to prevent extreme fluctuations
options.B: Total government control with no market influence
options.D: A system where only gold is traded

questions.question: What is the result of a currency appreciation for a country's exporters?

options.A: Their goods become more expensive for foreign buyers
options.B: Their goods become cheaper for foreign buyers

questions.question: The 'Gains from Trade' refer to the:

options.A: Increased total production and consumption resulting from specialization
options.B: Profit made by the government from tariffs
options.C: Loss of jobs in the domestic market

questions.question: Dumping in international trade refers to:

options.A: Throwing garbage into the ocean
options.C: Selling a product in a foreign market at a price lower than the cost of production

questions.question: The 'Capital Account' mainly records:

options.A: Gifts and aid between governments
options.B: The purchase and sale of consumer goods
options.C: The transfer of ownership of fixed assets and capital
options.D: The payment of wages to workers

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the World Trade Organization (WTO)?

options.A: To promote free trade and resolve trade disputes
options.B: To create a single world government
options.C: To prevent countries from trading with each other

questions.question: A 'Subsidy' to a domestic producer usually results in:

options.A: A lower price for the domestic product compared to imports
options.B: An increase in the price of raw materials
options.C: A decrease in the quality of the product
options.D: A total ban on foreign competition

questions.question: The 'Heckscher-Ohlin' theory explains trade based on:

options.A: Factor endowments (land, labor, capital)
options.B: The weather patterns of a country
options.D: The size of the national army

questions.question: A 'Trade Surplus' is beneficial because it:

options.A: Increases a nation's foreign exchange reserves

questions.question: What does a 'Financial Account' surplus indicate?

options.A: The country is a net debtor to the rest of the world
options.C: More investment capital is flowing into the country than out
options.D: The country is giving away all its money

questions.question: Currency 'Devaluation' is a deliberate ______ by the government.

options.A: Increase in the value of the currency
options.C: Reduction in the value of the currency in a fixed system

questions.question: Which of these is a 'Barrier to Trade'?

options.A: Technological standards and health regulations

questions.question: International trade often leads to 'Specialization', which means countries:

options.A: Try to produce every single product they need
options.B: Focus on producing goods where they are most efficient

questions.question: The 'Prebisch-Singer Hypothesis' suggests that over time:

options.A: The price of primary commodities falls relative to manufactured goods
options.B: All countries will eventually have the same GDP
options.D: Gold will lose all its value

questions.question: A 'Common Market' is a type of regional integration that allows:

options.A: Free movement of goods, services, and factors of production
options.B: Only the trade of agricultural goods
options.C: No movement of people between borders
options.D: Each country to have the same president

questions.question: The 'Foreign Exchange Market' (FOREX) is where:

options.A: Currencies are bought and sold

questions.question: In a 'Flexible' exchange rate system, the value of the currency is determined by:

options.A: The Minister of Finance
options.C: Market forces of demand and supply

questions.question: What is 'Outsourcing' in the context of global economics?

options.A: Hiring a third party (often abroad) to perform tasks previously done in-house
options.B: Increasing the number of government workers
options.D: Selling state-owned companies to local citizens

questions.question: A 'Customs Union' involves free trade among members and:

options.A: A common external tariff on non-members
options.D: The use of the same language

questions.question: The 'Most Favored Nation' (MFN) principle means:

options.A: A country must treat all WTO members equally in terms of trade barriers
options.B: A country can choose its best friend and only trade with them
options.C: Wealthy nations must give free goods to poor nations
options.D: Only one nation is allowed to export a specific good

questions.question: Exchange control refers to the government's power to:

options.A: Limit the amount of foreign currency citizens can buy or hold
options.D: Print as much money as it wants

questions.question: The 'J-Curve' effect describes how a currency depreciation may initially:

options.A: Worsen a trade deficit before improving it
options.D: Cause a country to leave the WTO

questions.question: Which of the following would lead to an increase in the demand for Ethiopian Birr?

options.A: An increase in foreign tourists visiting Ethiopia
options.B: Ethiopians buying more foreign products online
options.C: A decrease in the quality of Ethiopian exports

questions.question: A 'Debt Trap' occurs when a country:

options.A: Borrows so much that it cannot pay the interest on its loans
options.C: Lends money to every other country

questions.question: Comparative advantage is based on differences in:

options.A: Opportunity costs

questions.question: An 'Optimum Tariff' is one that:

options.A: Maximizes the economic well-being of the nation imposing it
options.B: Is set at 100% for all goods

questions.question: The primary goal of the IMF's 'Structural Adjustment Programs' (SAPs) is to:

options.A: Help countries correct fundamental economic imbalances
options.B: Build new schools and hospitals directly
options.C: Increase the power of labor unions
options.D: Ban the use of the US Dollar
